intro: Xanthoxalis mollissima, commonly known as the silky buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and soft, hairy leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Xanthoxalis mollissima is often used in ornamental gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation.
